Apply lighting models to surface normals with positional light support

Source: R/lighting.R
compute_lighting.Rd

Computes lighting values from surface normals using various lighting models. Supports both directional lighting (parallel rays) and positional lighting (point light sources with per-face light directions).

Usage

compute_lighting(normals, lighting = lighting(), face_centers = NULL)

Arguments

normals

Matrix with 3 columns (x, y, z normal components), where each row represents a face normal vector. Should be unit vectors (normalized).

lighting

A lighting specification object created by lighting()

face_centers

Matrix with 3 columns (x, y, z coordinates) representing the center position of each face in data coordinate space. Required for positional lighting, optional for directional lighting.

Value

Vector of lighting values. For most methods, returns numeric values. For method = "normal_rgb", returns hex color strings with I() class for identity scaling.
